wikipedia_page.main: William Lloyd George, 3rd Viscount Tenby, JP (born 7 November 1927), is a British peer and former Army officer. Tenby was elected one of the initial ninety hereditary peers to remain in the House of Lords after the passing of the House of Lords Act 1999 until his retirement in 2015.

response: ***William Lloyd George, 3rd Viscount Tenby, son of Gwilym, excepted hereditary peer
*** (8) 15px Rt. Hon. William Lloyd George, 3rd Viscount Tenby (born 1927). Elected to remain in the House in 1999; retired in 2015 and was replaced by Lord Mountevans.

Lloyd George married Edna Gwenfron, daughter of David Jones, in 1921. They had two children: David Lloyd George, 2nd Viscount Tenby (1922–1983), and William Lloyd George, 3rd Viscount Tenby (born 1927). He died aged 72, and was succeeded by his eldest son, David. Lady Tenby died in 1971.
